abstract: Tibor Varganyi, former employee of company that owned a crane that collapsed in 2009 killing two people on the Upper East Side, pleads guilty to criminally negligent homicide; also agrees to testify against his former boss, James F Lomma, the owner of New York Crane and Equipment Corporation.
snippet: A former employee of a company that owned a crane that collapsed two years ago and killed two people has agreed to testify against his former boss.
lead_paragraph: A former employee of a company that owned a crane that collapsed two years ago and killed two people has agreed to testify against his former boss.

headline.main: Employee Pleads Guilty in Fatal Crane Collapse
headline.print_headline: Employee Pleads Guilty In Fatal Crane Collapse
headline.seo: Ex-Employee Pleads Guilty in Fatal Crane Collapse
